comment._content: Porter Charlton an American bank clerk, was convicted of murdering his new wife Mary Scott during their honeymoon at Lake Como in 1910.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Apparently he is being hustled up the gangplank of a boat. Would it be the one taking him back to Italy for trial? Or is it the one returning him from Italy, after he served the laughable sentence of 29 days for murder? One of those dashing plainclothes carabinieri has a firm grip on Charlton's left elbow.

29 days probably would be an insufficient span of  time for poor Charlton to read the two books he carries with him . . . .

[Since the Bain agency has placed its copyright notice on the photo, we may assume that Bain's agent took the shot, at a dock in New York harbor.]
